title: Education loan Scheme

details.Name of the Scheme: Education loan Scheme
details.Funding by: Central Government Schemes  National Scheduled Castes Finance and Development Corporation, New Delhi (NSFDC)
details.Scheme Objective: The main object of the Corporation is to implement various schemes to uplift lifestyle of Charmakars (Dhor, Chambhar, Holar,Mochi etc.) who are economically weak and below poverty line and with an intention to develop them educationally, economically and socially so as to give them respectable place in Society. Also production of various types of Footwear  Leather Articles  supply to Government Departments  sale in Open Market.
details.Eligibility Criteria: Applicant must be of Charmakar Community only. Age Limit should be in between 18 to 50 years For 50% Subsidy Scheme and Margin Money, Annual Income of the applicants must be below poverty line and for NSFDC Scheme, income for Rural area should be below 98,000/- and for Urban Rs.1,20,000/-. Applicants must be permanent resident of Maharashtra State. He must produce the Income and Caste Certificate of Authorised Govt.Officer.Applicant must have a knowledge of the business for which he has applied for loan.
details.Benefits Provided: NSFDC, New Delhi has implemented EDUCTION LOAN scheme from 2009. Under this scheme, Eduction Loan up to Rs.10 ,00,000/-finance is provided for post graduate students in India and    Rs. 20,00,000/- in abroad. Rate of interest is 4%p.a. for male  3.5%p.a. for female beneficiary.
details.Application Process: Application form is available at District Office of LIDCOM.Applicant must fill form and submit to District Office of LIDCOM
details.Contact Office: List Enclosed.

title: Training Scheme

details.Name of the Scheme: training Scheme
details.Scheme Objective: The main object of the Corporation is to implement various schemes to uplift lifestyle of Charmakars (Dhor, Chambhar, Holar,Mochi etc.) who are economically weak and below poverty line and with an intention to develop them educationally, economically and socially so as to give them respectable place in Society. Also production of various types of Footwear ,  Leather Articles ,  supply to Government Departments ,  sale in Open Market.
details.Eligibility Criteria: Applicant must be of Charmakar Community only.  Age Limit should be in between 18 to 50 years  For 50% Subsidy Scheme and Margin Money, Annual Income of the applicants must be below poverty line and for NSFDC Scheme, income for Rural area should be below 98,000/- and for Urban Rs.1,20,000/-.  Applicants must be permanent resident of Maharashtra State.  He must produce the Income and Caste Certificate of Authorised Govt.Officer.  Applicant must have a knowledge of the business for which he has applied for loan.
details.Benefits Provided: training Scheme is implemented for the students to enable them to start their own business, trade or to get a job. training is given under this scheme in various trades such as Motor Driving, T.V./Video/Radio Repairing, Tailoring, Welding etc. for a period upto six months. Stipend and  tution fees are also paid by the Corporation to the training institute.
details.Application Process: Application form is available at District Office of LIDCOM.  Applicant must fill form and submit to District Office of LIDCOM
details.Contact Office: List Enclosed.

title: Maintenance Allowance to B.C. Students Studying in Sainik School.

details.Name of the Scheme: Maintenance Allowance to B.C. Students Studying in Sainik School.
details.Scheme Objective: OBC students should have access to national protection Prabodhini, military forces to be recruited them students, students in the discipline, confidence, courage, leadership, patriotism has been launched to cultivate these qualities, etc.
details.Eligibility Criteria: Parents income is not more than Rs. 2 Lakhs per year.  Since 1996-1997 onwards the students who are studying in GIA voluntary schools are paid 15000 per year for their educational fees.
details.Benefits Provided: Students Studying in Sainik Schools, Samara, Nashik and Pune, the entire expenditure on Tuition Fees, Exam Fees, Lodging, Boarding, Cloth, Uniforms, Horse-riding, Pocket Money etc., incurred by these schools for B.C. students is reimbursed to these schools by social Welfare Department
details.Application Process: Student should fill the application form on this website  http//mahaeschool.maharashtra.gov.in
details.Contact Office: Related Assistant Commissioner (District), Social welfare and Head Master of Sainik School

title: Training of Motor Driving to VJNT, SBC & OBC

details.Name of the Scheme: Training of Motor Driving to VJNT, SBC & OBCS
details.Scheme Objective: To create employment chances for VJNT, OBC & SBC youth.
details.Eligibility Criteria: Applicant should belong to VJNT, OBC or SBC Category.Applicant should fulfill  all the conditions of Age, Education, and fitness as per Motor Vehicle Act.
details.Benefits Provided: The scheme provides light and heavy motor driving, conductor training to the needy VJNT, OBC & SBC candidates. The training is given through private motor driving schools. The selected candidates are provided training with free lodging and boarding facility, License Fees etc.
details.Application Process: Application is to be submitted to Motor Driving School approved under this scheme by Government of Maharashtra Social Justice Department.
details.Contact Office: Approved Driving School.Assistant Commissioner of Social Welfare concerned District.

title: Savitribai Phule Scholarship for VJNT and SBC girls students studying in 5th to 7th std.

details.Name of the Scheme: Savitribai Phule Scholarship for V.J.N.T and S.B.C girls students studying in 5th to 7th std.
details.Scheme Objective: For encouraging the enrollment and presently of VJNT / SBC girl students studying in 5th to 7th standard, Government has introduced this scheme.
details.Eligibility Criteria: Girl Student should belong to V.J.N.T. or S.B.C category.Girl Student should be studying in 5th to 7th Standard in recognised school.No income limit and there will be no limit of marks.
details.Benefits Provided: VJNT and SBC girl students studying in 5th to 7th standard will receive scholarship @ Rs.60 per month for 10 months. This scheme as a separate scheme apart from the other scholarships.
details.Application Process: This is a paperless scheme. Student or her parents are not required to apply or submit any documents. The Head-Master of the concerned school should submit the list of VJNT and SBC girl students to concerned District Social Welfare Officer, Zillah Parishad of concerned district for sanction of this scholarship.
details.Contact Office: District Social Welfare Zillah Parishad of concerned District.Head Master of concerned School.

title: Meritorious Scholarships to VJNT and SBC students studying in Secondary Schools.

details.Name of the Scheme: Meritorious Scholarships to VJNT and SBC students studying in Secondary Schools.
details.Scheme Objective: To motivate Backward Class students for education.
details.Eligibility Criteria: Students who secure more than 50 percentage marks in previous year’s annual examination and stood first or second in the class.He should belonging to VJNT / SBC category.He should be studying in 5th to 10th standard.There is no income limit for this scholarship.
details.Benefits Provided: Rs. 200/- for 5th to 7th and Rs. 400/- for 8th to 10th standard per annum.
details.Application Process: Proposal is to be submitted by Head Master of concerned School through concerned Block Education Officer to District Social Welfare Officer, Zillah Parishad concerned. For Mumbai city only proposals are to be submitted to Assistant Commissioner of Social Welfare, Mumbai City.
details.Contact Office: The Head Master of School.District Social Welfare Officer, Zillah Parishad concerned.The Assistant Commissioner of Social Welfare Mumbai City.

title: Tuition fees and Examination fees to VJNT/SBC students studying in High Schools.

details.Name of the Scheme: Tuition fees and Examination fees to VJNT/SBC students studying in High Schools.
details.Scheme Objective: To improve the interests of VJNT/SBC students in High Schools. To help and encourage the VJNT/SBC parents/ guardians for their children education.
details.Eligibility Criteria: Student should belong to VJNT/SBC Category.He should be a student of a recognised High School.No limit of age or income.Students getting benefit of other scholarships are not eligible.One's failure is eligible. Twice failure is not eligible.
details.Benefits Provided: Tuition fees, Examination fees, Laboratory fees, Library fees etc. fees are sanctioned and paid to concerned School.
details.Application Process: Proposal is to be submitted by Head Master of concerned School through concerned Block Education Officer to District Social Welfare Officer, Zillah Parishad concerned. For Mumbai city only proposals are to be submitted to Assistant Commissioner of Social Welfare, Mumbai City.
details.Contact Office: The Head Master of School.District Social Welfare Officer, Zillah Parishad concerned.The Assistant Commissioner of Social Welfare Mumbai City.

title: Award of stipend to VJNT and SBC students studying in ITI

details.Name of the Scheme: Award of stipend to V.J.N.T and S.B.C students studying in I.T.I
details.Scheme Objective: To encourage V.J.N.T. & S.B.C. students and promote the interest in Technical education.
details.Eligibility Criteria: 1) Student should belong to V.J.N.T. or S.B.C category.2) Student should be trainee of approved I.T.I.3) Parent/Guardian's income should be up to 65290/- per year.
details.Benefits Provided: Maintenance Allowance from Rs.40/- to Rs.100/- per month for 10 months is provided through concerned I.T.I.
details.Application Process: Application should be submitted to concerned I.T.I. Selection process is also completed by I.T.I.
details.Contact Office: Assistant Commissioner of Social Welfare concerned District.Principal, Industrial Training Institute.

title: Vocational Training for VJNT and SBC candidates studying in Government Industrial Training Institute.

details.Name of the Scheme: Vocational Training for VJNT and SBC candidates studying in Government Industrial Training Institute.
details.Scheme Objective: The State Government has introduced in 2003-04 the scheme to create self-employment for unemployed youths and students of VJNT and SBC who apply for a Vocational Training. He will be given the Vocational Training in Government I.T.I and undergo short duration vocational training courses. The short duration vocational courses will enable the youths to create their own employment in service sector.
details.Eligibility Criteria: 1) Student should belong to VJNT or SBC Category.2) Selection of students for training under this scheme is made by Principal of concerned Govt. I.T.I. & concerned Asstt.Commissioner of Social Welfare.
details.Benefits Provided: The training fees Rs.400/- to Rs.2400/- (as per course) is paid to concerned I.T.I. After completion of training, one Tool Kit of Rs.1000/- is provided to trainee through concerned Govt. I.T.I.
details.Application Process: Student should apply for short Training to concerned Govt. I.T.I.Selection of students is made by Principal of concerned Govt. I.T.I.
details.Contact Office: Assistant Commissioner of Social Welfare concerned District.Principal of Government Industrial Training Institutes.

title: Maintenance allowance to Backward Class students under training in Sainik Schools.

details.Name of the Scheme: Maintenance allowance to Backward Class students under training in Sainik Schools.
details.Scheme Objective: VJNT and SBC students are paid maintenance so that a maximum number of students can take admission to Sainik School with a view to seek admission in N.D.A.
details.Eligibility Criteria: 1) Students should belong to Vimukta Jatis, Nomadic Tribes orSpecial Backward Class.2) Student should be studying in 5th to 12th standard in SainikSchool.
details.Benefits Provided: The entire expenditure on lodging, boarding, clothing, uniform, horse riding, pocket money, tuition fees and examination fees is reimbursed to the students admitted in old three Sainik Schools e.g. Satara, Pune and Nashik.For the remaining Sainik Schools maintenance allowance of Rs.15,000/- is reimbursed to per student for a year.
details.Application Process: Scheme is online.Student should go to https:\\mahaeschool.maharashtra.gov.in and fill the Sainik School Scholarship application form, upload documents and submit it to concerned School. After scrutiny concerned school should forward his application to concerned Asstt. Comm. Social Welfare for sanction.
details.Contact Office: Assistant Commissioner of Social Welfare concerned District.Principal of Sainik School of concerned district.

title: Payment of maintenance allowance to VJNT and SBC students studying in professional courses and living in hostel attached to professional colleges.

details.Name of the Scheme: Payment of maintenance allowance to V.J.N.T and SBC students studying in professional courses and living in hostel attached to professional colleges.
details.Scheme Objective: This scheme is introduced to complete the education of V.J.N.T and S.B.C students who are the student of professional courses.
details.Eligibility Criteria: Student should belong to VJNT or SBC category.Student should be studying in professional course such as Medical, Engineering, Animal Husbandry etc.Student should submit Application form for admission in Govt. Hostel.Student should have admitted in the hostels attached toProfessional colleges or approved private hostels.
details.Benefits Provided: Professional courses are divided into A,B,C category and accordingly maintenance allowance is given to the students through the concerned Principal of the college.For 4 to 5 years course (Medical, Engineering, Agriculture etc.) Rs. 700/- per month, for 2 to 3 years course (Engineering Dip., M.B.A, M.S.W etc.) Rs. 500/- and for 2 years and lesser duration courses (B.Ed., D.Ed.) Rs. 500/- per month for 10 months as maintenance allowance in addition to other Government Scholarships.
details.Application Process: Scheme is online.Student should go to https:\\mahaeschol.maharashtra.gov.in and fill the application form, upload documents and submit it to concerned College. After scrutiny concerned College should forward his application to concerned Asstt. Comm. Social Welfare for sanction.
details.Contact Office: Assistant Commissioner of Social Welfare concerned District.Principal of concerned College.

title: Savitribai Phule Scholarship for VJNT and SBC girls students studying in 8th to 10 std.

details.Name of the Scheme: Savitribai Phule Scholarship for V.J.N.T and S.B.C girls students studying in 8th to 10 std.
details.Scheme Objective: For encouraging the enrollment and presently of VJNT / SBC girl students studying in 8th to 10th standard, Government has introduced this scheme from the academic year 2003-04.
details.Eligibility Criteria: 1) Girl Student should belong to V.J.N.T. or S.B.C category.2) Girl Student should be studying in 8th to 10th Standard.3) No income limit and there will be no limit of marks.
details.Benefits Provided: VJNT and SBC girl students studying in 8th to 10th standard will receive scholarship @ Rs.100 per month for 10 months. This scheme as a separate scheme apart from the other scholarships.
details.Application Process: This is a paperless scheme. Student or her parents are not required to apply or submit any documents. The Head-Master of the concerned school should submit the list of VJNT and SBC girl students to concerned Asstt. Commissioner of Social Welfare of concerned district for sanction of this scholarship.
details.Contact Office: Assistant Commissioner of Social Welfare concerned District.Head Master of concerned School.

title: Rajarshi Chhatrapati Shahu Maharaj Merit Scholarship.

details.Name of the Scheme: Rajarshi Chhatrapati Shahu Maharaj Merit Scholarship.
details.Scheme Objective: To create competition spirit among VJNT and SBC students, Government has introduced this scheme from the academic year 2003-04, vide G.R no.EBC-204/CR-2004/BCW-3, dated 25th July 2003.This scholarship is separate from Post Matric Scholarship. No income limit is applicable.
details.Eligibility Criteria: Students should belong to Vimukta Jatis, Nomadic Tribes orSpecial Backward Class.Student should be studying in 11th and 12th standard.Student should secure 75% and above marks in 10th standard Examination.
details.Benefits Provided: Scholarship of Rs.300/- p.m. for 10 months i.e.Rs.3000/- per year for the standard 2nd & 12th is provided.
details.Application Process: Scheme is online.Student should go to https:\\mahaeschol.maharashtra.gov.in and fill the Chhatrapati Shahu Maharaj Scholarship application form, upload documents and submit it to concerned college. After scrutiny concerned college should forward his application to concerned Asstt. Comm. Social Welfare for sanction.
details.Contact Office: Assistant Commissioner of Social Welfare concerned District.Principal of concerned College.

title: Education Loan (National Backward Classes Finance & Development Corporation, New Delhi & State Corporation jointly.)

details.Name of the Scheme: Education Loan
details.Funding by: National Backward Classes Finance & Development Corporation, New Delhi & State Corporation jointly.
details.Scheme Objective: To provide loan to the Students studying in Profession and Technical courses in Government recognised Institutes.
details.Eligibility Criteria: Applicant should be OBC Category.He should be domicile of Maharashtra State.Age between 18 to 50 yrs.Annual Income of the family for Rural Area Rs.98,000/- and for Urban Area Rs.1,20,000/-
details.Benefits Provided: Provide loan to student beneficiary at lower interest rate.
details.Application Process: Loan application should be submitted to concern District Office in prescribed loan application along with required documents.
details.Contact Office: Concern District Office of the Corporation.

title: Opening and maintenance of Public School (Vidya Niketan) for Vimukta Jatis and Nomadic Tribes

details.Name of the Scheme: Opening and maintenance of Public School (Vidya Niketan) for Vimukta Jatis and Nomadic Tribes
details.Scheme Objective: Government has granted permission to voluntary organization to run the Public School (Vidya Niketan) on grant-in-aid basis at Kamlewadi, Taluka Mukhed, District Nanded for the needy, brilliant and talented students belonging to VJNT Category. In this public school, students gets education from 5th to 12th standard on merit basis.
details.Eligibility Criteria: Beneficiary should be resident of Maharashtra.Beneficiary should belong to the VJNT community.Income of the parents should not be more than Rs. 24000/- per annum.Beneficiary should clear the competitive examination Student belonging to VJNT category & those who studying in 4th Standard are eligible to take admission in VJNT Ashram School on merit basis
details.Benefits Provided: Financial Assistance is given to the institution for maintenance assistance is given on building rent. 100 percent salary grants for approved teaching and non-teaching staff. Students are provided facilities like books, note books, uniforms, education stationary free lodging and boarding facilities. Rs.1450/- p.m. per residential student is admissible.
details.Application Process: Students of an approved VJNT Ashram School studying in 4th standard should apply for entrance test through Head Master of concerned Ashram School. As per merit of marks in entrance test, Scholar students are selected for admission in 5th class in Public school.
details.Contact Office: Assistant Commissioner Social Welfare of concerned District.Principal of Vidyaniketan, Kamlewadi, Tq. Mukhed Dist. Nanded

title: Opening and running Junior Colleges for VJNT students run by voluntary agencies.

details.Name of the Scheme: Opening and running Junior Colleges for VJNT students run by voluntary agencies.
details.Scheme Objective: For educational and social development of VJNT students Govt. vide G.R. dated 26/6/2008 has started (11th and 12th class) Junior College education by upgrading the 148 secondary Ashram Schools in existence. Free lodging and boarding facilities along with necessary educational goods, stationary is being provided as per norms.
details.Eligibility Criteria: Students should be resident of Maharashtra.Students should belong VJNT Category.Voluntary Agency should have running Secondary Ashram School.The result of Secondary School should not below than 60%Voluntary Agency should economically sound to run Jr. College.Building, Water supply, Electricity etc. facilities should be available.Most of Population should be VJNT nearby School place.There should not be more Junior Colleges around the Ashram School.There should not be any dispute / Court matter against the Voluntary Agency.
details.Benefits Provided: In these Junior Colleges along with the academic educational facility, free lodging and boarding is provided. Also medical facilities, bedding and clothing, uniforms are provided to the residential students. This scheme is implemented on grant-in-aid basis to voluntary organisations.
details.Application Process: Admissions are finalised by the Head Master of the concerned Ashram School Head Master.
details.Contact Office: Assistant Commissioner Social Welfare of concerned District.Head Master of concerned Ashram School.

title: Opening and running Ashram Schools for VJNT students through voluntary agencies.

details.Name of the Scheme: Opening and running Ashram Schools for VJNT students through voluntary agencies.
details.Scheme Objective: As a special measure for providing educational facilities to the pupils belonging to Vimukta Jatis and Nomadic Tribes, Government has encouraged the establishment of Ashram Schools with residential facilities to the children since 1954 through recognized NGO’s. Permission to open Ashram Schools is granted to such voluntary agencies which show interest in conducting schools for Vimukta Jatis / Nomadic Tribes etc., and are prepared to maintain the Ashram School as per terms and conditions prescribed by Government.
details.Eligibility Criteria: Student should belong to VJNT category.
details.Benefits Provided: In these schools along with the academic educational facility, free lodging and boarding is provided. Also medical facilities, bedding and clothing, uniforms are provided to the residential students. This scheme is implemented on grant-in-aid basis to voluntary organisations.100% Salary and non-salary grants of Teaching, Non-teaching and Hostel approved employees are paid by Government. Rs.900/- p.m. maintenance grant per residential student is admissible.
details.Application Process: Admissions are finalised by the Head Master of the concerned Ashram School Head Master.
details.Contact Office: Assistant Commissioner Social Welfare of concerned District.Head Master of concerned Ashram School.

title: Vasantrao Naik Merit Awards to the VJNT students who came First in State or First in Board of 10th and 12th Standard Examination.

details.Name of the Scheme: Vasantrao Naik Merit Awards to the VJNT students who came First in State or First in Board of 10th and 12th Standard Examination.
details.Scheme Objective: To motivate VJNT students for Higher Education.
details.Eligibility Criteria: Student should belong to VJNT category.Student should be First in State, or First in Board Examination of 10th or 12th.standard.First Boy and First Girl Student who stood first in state and board both are eligible for Award.
details.Benefits Provided: Award of Rs. 1.00 lakh trophy and Certificate for one Boy and one Girl Student who came First in State in S.S.C. Exam.Award of Rs. 0.51 lakh trophy and Certificate for one Boy and one Girl Student who came First in each Board in S.S.C. Exam.Award of Rs. 1.00 lakh trophy and Certificate for one Boy and one Girl Student who came First in State in H.S.C. Exam.Award of Rs. 0.51 lakh trophy and Certificate for one Boy and one Girl Student who came First in each Board in H.S.C. Exam
details.Application Process: A list of all VJNT students passing SSC and HSC Exams, in state is called for from the State Board of SSC/HSC by the Director, VJNT, OBC and SBC, M.S. Pune. The selection of students is made on the basis of marks obtained in SSC or HSC Exam.
details.Contact Office: Assistant Commissioner of Social Welfare concerned District.Director, VJNT, OBC, SBC. Welfare, M.S. Pune.

title: Tuition fees and examination fees to VJNT students.

details.Name of the Scheme: Tuition fees and examination fees to VJNT students.
details.Scheme Objective: Under the scheme, all the students belonging to V.J. and N.T. are being reimbursed of the payment of (i) Tuition Fees, (ii) Admission Fees (iii) Term Fees (iv) Library Fees, (v) Laboratory Fees, (vi) Gymkhana Fees, and (vii) Examination Fees at Post Matriculation education in recognized educational institutions. Student with one failure and those not covered under Government of India Scholarship are also held eligible for such reimbursement.
details.Eligibility Criteria: He should belongs to VJNT category.Reimbursement will be sanctioned to the students,whose parents income is between 1.00 lakh to 4.50Lakhs.
details.Benefits Provided: All types of compulsory fees such as Tuition fees, Exam. Fees & other fees are reimbursed to the concern college/institution.
details.Application Process: Scheme is online.Student should go to https:\\mahaeschol.maharashtra.gov.inAnd fill the Free ship application form, upload documents and submit it to concerned college. After scrutiny concerned college should forward his application to concerned Asstt. Comm. Social Welfare for sanction.Online application is to be filled for the first year of that course only. From Ian year to completion of course, application is renewed by concerned college and forwarded to concerned Asstt. Comm. Social Welfare for sanction.
details.Contact Office: Assistant Commissioner of Social Welfare concerned District.Principal of concerned College.

title: Post-Matric Scholarship to VJNT students.

details.Name of the Scheme: Post-Matric Scholarship to VJNT students.
details.Scheme Objective: In order to encourage the VJNT students to undergo Post-Matric Courses, the Government of Maharashtra has introduced a scheme known as the Government of Maharashtra Post-Matric Scholarship to V.J.N.T. students.
details.Eligibility Criteria: (1)The parents/Guardians whose annual income up to Rs.1.00 lakh can get full scholarship and free ship.(2) Students engaged in full time employment are not eligible (3) Repeaters are not eligible for that standard. After passing they are eligible for higher standard.(4) All children of the same parents are eligible for the Scholarship.(5) No scholarship will be paid to the students under this scheme from the date he /she accepts another  Scholarship / stipend.
details.Benefits Provided: Eligible V.J.N.T. Students are paid maintenance allowance from Rs. 90 to Rs. 190 per month for hostellers and Rs. 150 to Rs. 425 per month for day scholar students. In addition to maintenance allowance all fees which are compulsorily payable by the students to the institutions are also being paid under the scheme.
details.Application Process: Scheme is online.Student should go to https:\\mahaeschool.maharashtra.gov.in and fill the Scholarship application form, upload documents and submit it to concerned college. After scrutiny concerned college should forward his application to concerned Asstt. Comm. Social Welfare for sanction.Online application is to be filled for the first year of that course only. From Ian year to completion of course, application is renewed by concerned college and forwarded to concerned Asstt. Comm. Social Welfare for sanction.
details.Contact Office: Assistant Commissioner of Social Welfare concerned District.Principal of concerned College.

title: Government institution for Special Education and Vocational Training Centre

details.Name of the Scheme: Government institution for Special Education and Vocational Training Centre
details.Scheme objective: Special education given to special children in these Government special school between the age 6 to 18 yr and above 18 yrs the vocational training given to special children.
details.Beneficiaries Category: Visually Impaired, Hearing Impaired, Orthopaedically Handicapped
details.Eligibility criteria: (1) Application in given  format submitted to concern Govt.Institution        (2) Applicant should have minimum 40% disability.        (3) Applicant should be Domicile in Maharashtra.
details.Benefits Provided: Child with a disability has access to free education in an appropriate environment till he / she  attains the age of eighteen years & above 18 years vocational training given to special children. The free facilities of food, shelter, clothing and education are provided in these institutions
details.Application process: Application in given format attached with necessary documents submitted Concern Govt.Institution
details.Contact Office: Government Institution and District social welfare office Zilha parishad/Assistant Commissioner Social welfare office Mumbai urban / Mumbai suburban

title: Non-Governmental Aided organization (Special Schools and Vocational Training Centre) for Disable.

details.Name of the Scheme: Non-Governmental Aided organization (Special Schools and Vocational Training Centre) for Disable.
details.Scheme objective: Special education is provided to disabled children below the age of 18 years in the special school which are run by Non-Governmental Aided organization. Vocational training is also given to special children above 18 yrs
details.Beneficiaries Category: Visually Impaired, Hearing Impaired ,Orthopedically Handicapped, Mentally Retarded
details.Eligibility criteria: 1.Application in given format submitted to concern special        School / Vocational Training centre.        2. Applicant should have minimum 40% disability.        3.Applicant should be Domicile in Maharashtra
details.Benefits Provided: Child with a disability has access to free education in an appropriate environment till he / she attains the age of eighteen years. Above 18 years vocational training is given to disabled children. Also free facilities of food, shelter and education are provided in residential institutions.
details.Application process: Application in given format attached with necessary documents submitted to Concern voluntary organization
details.Contact Office: voluntary organization and District social welfare office Zillah Parishad/Assistant Commissioner Social welfare office Mumbai urban / Mumbai suburban

title: Tuition fees and examination fees to OBC. students.

details.Name of the Scheme: Tuition fees and examination fees to O.B.C. students.
details.Scheme Objective: Under the scheme, the students belonging to O.B.C. are being reimbursed of the payment of (i) Tuition Fees, (ii) Admission Fees (iii) Term Fees (iv) Library Fees, (v) Laboratory Fees, (vi) Gymkhana Fees, and (vii) Examination Fees at Post Matriculation education in recognized educational institutions. Student with one failure and those not covered under Government of India Scholarship are also held eligible for such reimbursement.
details.Eligibility Criteria: (1) He should belongs to O.B.C. category.(2) Reimbursement will be sanctioned to the students,whose parents income is between 1.00 lakh to 4.50Lakhs.
details.Benefits Provided: All types of compulsory fees such as Tuition fees, Exam. Fees & other fees are reimbursed to the concern college/institution. Only 50% Education fees is allowed to professional courses.
details.Application Process: Scheme is online.Student should go to https:\\mahaeschol.maharashtra.gov.inAnd fill the Free ship application form, upload documents and submit it to concerned college. After scrutiny concerned college should forward his application to concerned Asstt. Comm. Social Welfare for sanction.Online application is to be filed for the first year of that course only. From Ian year to completion of course, application is renewed by concerned college and forwarded to concerned Asstt. Comm. Social Welfare for sanction.
details.Contact Office: Assistant Commissioner of Social Welfare concerned District.Principal of concerned College.

title: Post-Matric Scholarship to OBC. students.

details.Name of the Scheme: Post-Matric Scholarship to O.B.C. students.
details.Scheme Objective: In order to encourage the O.B.C. students to undergo Post-Matric Courses, the Government of Maharashtra has introduced a scheme known as the Government of Maharashtra Post-Matric Scholarship to O.B.C. students.
details.Eligibility Criteria: (1) The parents/Guardians whose annual income up toRs.1.00 lakh can get full scholarship and free ship.(2) Students engaged in full time employment are noteligible Repeaters are not eligible for that standard. After passing they are eligible for higher standard.(3) All children of the same parents are eligible for the Scholarship.(4) No scholarship will be paid to the students under thisscheme from the date he /she accepts anotherScholarship / stipend.
details.Benefits Provided: Eligible O.B.C. Students are paid maintenance allowance from Rs. 90 to Rs. 190 per month for hostellers and Rs. 150 to Rs. 425 per month for day scholar students. In addition to maintenance allowance all fees which are compulsorily payable by the students to the institutions are also being paid under the scheme.
details.Application Process: Scheme is online.Student should go to https:\\mahaeschool.maharashtra.gov.in and fill the Scholarship application form, upload documents and submit it to concerned college. After scrutiny concerned college should forward his application to concerned Asstt. Comm. Social Welfare for sanction.Online application is to be filled for the first year of that course only. From 2nd year to completion of course, application is renewed by concerned college and forwarded to concerned Asstt .Comm. Social Welfare for sanction.
details.Contact Office: Assistant Commissioner of Social Welfare concerned District.Principal of concerned College.

title: Homes for Intellectually Impaired Persons

details.Name of the Scheme: Homes for Intellectually Impaired Persons
details.Scheme objective: Mentally Deficient Children Home functioning under the provisions of Maharashtra Juvenile Justice (Care & Protection of children) Act 2000 and amendment Act 2006. The numbers of MDC homes are 19 out of which 14 are granted and 5 are non- granted.
details.Beneficiaries Category: Mentally retarded children who are in need of care and protection.

title: Scholarship to the Scheduled Caste Students for Aboard Studies.

details.Name of the Scheme: Scholarship to the Scheduled Caste Students for Aboard Studies.
details.Scheme Objective: Due to weak economic and financial condition Scheduled Caste students cannot afford the higher education in prominent universities in the foreign countries.  To overcome this difficulty Government of Maharashtra has introduced this scheme as per G.R. No. EBC-2003/C No. 115/BC-2, dated 11th June 2003.
details.Eligibility Criteria: For this scholarship parents income limit is Rs. 6.00 lakhs per year.  Students have make contract with the Government that after successful completion of foreign education he will pay minimum 10 per cent of the total expenditure to the Social Justice Fund, but it optional.
details.Benefits Provided: Selected students will get full Tuition fee and fixed by the foreign university maintenance allowance 14000 USD or 9000 GBP. The Tuition fee will be paid directly to the university.  If students do not complete the course/education it is compulsory for him to refund all the expenses incurred by the Government for his Course.
details.Application Process: Manual form should be filled by student then submitted it to Social Welfare Commissionerate office
details.Contact Office: Social Welfare Commissionerate Office, Maharashtra State, Pune

Indian Institute of Management Institute of Technology where admissions are given through the entrance examinations.
details.Benefits Provided: Awardee students will get full fee prescribed by the institutions as well as Hostel and Mess Charges prescribed by the institutions.  Besides this Rs. 10000 per year will be given for Books, Note Books, and other educational instruments.

title: To Start Government Hostels for Backward Class boys and girls

details.Name of scheme: To Start Government Hostels for Backward Class boys and girls
details.Purpose of the scheme: To provide education and higher education in the weaker section of backward class students in the society.  For these purpose these government hostels are started.  This scheme is started from the year 1922.  Now there are old 271 and new 103 girls and boys hostels working in the Maharashtra State at District & Taluka. Level.  Out of them here are 208 boys hostels and 159 girls hostels running in the State and 32988 students are availing benefits of this scheme.
details.The scheme is applicable to the category: SC / Vimukta / Nomadic tribes / Other magapravarga / category Special Backward / disability / sweeper
details.Terms of major scheme: (1) Students are given admission in the hostels on basis of merit.(2) Student should be resident of Maharashtra State.(3) Annual income of the parents of the student should be not more than Rs. 2,00,000.(4) Students who are studying in the 8th Std and above 8th Std. should apply for the hostel.(5) Student who has studying in school should by online method apply for hostel before 15th May and college students should be applying before 30th June.(6) From the year 2015-16, on government level 10% of the total vacant seats are filled from special quota according to terms and condition.
details.Given the nature of the benefit: (1) Free accommodation, food, cloths, library & other facilities are provided to these students admitted in hostels.(2) Per year 2 uniforms are provided to the school students.(3) Educational text books and stationary are provided.(4) Medical and Engineering students are provided free educational kits according to their course like stethoscope, drawing board, apron, boiler suits and for arts students color, drawing board, brush and canvas etc.(5) Hostel students are availing facility of daily expenses as below(6) Regional level per month to Rs 800 / -(7) District level per month to Rs 600 / -Taluka level per month to Rs 500 / -
details.Name Office Contact: Concerned Regional Deputy Commissioner, Social Welfare and Assistant Commissioner, Social Welfare and Warden, backward class boys and girls hostel.

title: Division level 1000 capacity Backward class boys and girls hostel.

details.Name of scheme: Division level 1000 capacity Backward class boys and girls hostel.
details.purpose of the scheme: According to increased different higher educational institutes higher education level of Scheduled caste and Navbouddha government hostels are less in the State.  Due to this these SC/ Navbouddha students are not getting admission the Government Hostel.  According to this 1000 students capacity division level hostel each hostel for 1 region, government decided to start 7 division level hostels in the year 2007.  Because of this decision backward students get admission in the hostel and these students completed their higher education.  On division level there are 4 units of 250 students capacity and among this 4 unit 1 unit is for girl hostel.  Because of starting this division level hostel 5250 boys and 1750 girls seats are ready for the hostel admission.
details.The scheme is applicable to the category: SC / ST / Nomadic tribes / Other Backward class / special backward class / disabled
details.Terms of major scheme: Students are admitted in the hostels on basis of merit.Student should be resident of Maharashtra State.Annual income of the parents of the student should not be more than 2,00,000.Student who are studying in the 8th Std and above 8th Std. are able to apply for the hostel.Students who are studying in school should apply for hostel before 15th May and college students should apply before 30th June.From the year 2015-16, on government level 10% of the total vacant seats are filled from special quota according to terms and condition.
details.Given the nature of the benefit: Free accommodation, food, cloths, library and many other facilities are provided to these students.Per year 2 uniforms are provided to the admitted students.Educational books and stationary are provided.Medical and Engineering students are provided free educational kits according to their course like stethoscope, drawing board, apron, boiler suits and for art students color, drawing board, brush and canvas etc. are provided.Admitted Hostel students are availing daily expenses facility as belowRegional level per month to Rs 800 / -District level per month to Rs 600 / -Taluka level per month to Rs 500 / -
details.Name Office Contact: Concerned Regional Deputy Commissioner, Social Welfare and Assistant Commissioner, Social Welfare and Warden, backward class boys and girls hostel.

details.Name of the Scheme: Post-Matric Scholarship & Other Educational Facilities to S.B.C. students.
details.Scheme Objective: In order to encourage the S.B.C. students to undergo Post-Matric Courses, the Government of Maharashtra has introduced a scheme known as the Government of Maharashtra Post-Matric Scholarship & Free ship to S.B.C. students.
details.Eligibility Criteria: (1) The parents/Guardians whose annual income up toRs.1.00 lakh can get full scholarship and free ship.The parents/Guardians whose annual income is above1.00 lakh and up to 4.50 lakhs can get free ship.(Educational fee, Examination fee & other fees only)(2) Students engaged in full time employment are noteligible(3)Repeaters are not eligible for that standard. title: Gattai Stall

details.Name of the Scheme: Gattai Stall
details.Scheme Objective: The main object of the  Corporation is to implement various schemes to uplift lifestyle of  Charmakars (Dhor, Chambhar, Holar,Mochi etc.) who are economically  weak and below poverty line and with an intention to develop them  educationally, economically and socially so as to give them  respectable place in Society. Also production of various types of  Footwear & Leather Articles & supply to Government  Departments & sale in Open Market.
details.Eligibility Criteria: Applicant  must be of Charmakar Community only.      Age  Limit should be in between 18 to 50 years       For  50% Subsidy Scheme and Margin Money, Annual Income of the applicants must be below poverty line and for NSFDC Scheme,  income for Rural area should be below 98,000/- and for Urban  Rs.1,20,000/-.       Applicants  must be permanent resident of Maharashtra State.       He  must produce the Income and Caste Certificate of Authorised  Govt.Officer.      Applicant  must have a knowledge of the business for which he has applied  for loan.

details.Application Process: Application  form is available at District Social Welfare Office      Applicant must fill form and  submit to District Social Welfare Office

title: Financial Assistance to Self-Employment for Trained Disabled Persons

details.Name of the Scheme: Financial Assistance to Self-Employment for Trained Disabled Persons
details.Scheme objective: Financial assistance to facilitate purchase of equipment for those disable persons who are completing vocational training from government institutions or recognize institution to start their own business.
details.Beneficiaries Category: Visually handicapped, Low vision, hearing impaired, and orthopedically handicapped
details.Eligibility criteria: 1.Application in prescribed format submitted to concern District Social Welfare Office, Zillah Parishad & Assistant Commissioner Social Welfare Office ,Mumbai Urban & Mumbai Suburban        2.Applicant must completed their vocational training in Government or Government recognized institution        3.Applicant should have minimum 40% disability.        3.Applicant should be Domicile in Maharashtra.        4.Applicant should submit their proposal with proposed project cost.
details.Benefits Provided: The State Government of Maharashtra has provided financial assistance of Rs. 1000/- for purchase of total kits/ equipments to start their own business .
details.Application process: Application in prescribed format attached with necessary documents.
details.Contact Office: District Social Welfare Office ,Zillah Parishad & Assistant Commissioner Social Welfare Office ,Mumbai Urban & Mumbai Suburban

title: Financial Assistance scheme to the Co-operative Industrial societies of Scheduled Castes

details.Name Of the Scheme: Providing Mini tractor and its sub parts to the Self Help Group of Scheduled Castes
details.Scheme Objective: In order to improve the financial condition of the scheduled castes and Nav-Buddhists Self Help Group.
details.Eligibility Criteria: There are 1 to 13 terms and conditions. Major terms and conditions are-      1. Applicant should be The scheduled castes and Nav-Buddhists and domicile of Maharashtra state.      2. The Self-help Group must consist of 80% of scheduled castes and Nav-Buddhists members.      3. The cost of Mini tractor and its sub parts is estimated of Rs. 3.50 lakhs. Self-help Group must collect 10 % of this amount of Rs. 35,000/- and government will provide remaining 90% subsidy of Rs. 3,10,000/-.
details.Benefits Provided: Government provide mini tractor along with its sub parts like trolley, rotator etc.The cost of one mini tractor along with its sub parts is Rs. 3,50,000/-The 10  % of  this amount is collected by the self-help group and  remainingRs. 3,15,000/- is the subsidy given by the govt.
details.Application Process: Application has to be submitted to Assistant Commissioner, District Social welfare office.
details.Contact Office: Assistant Commissioner, Social Welfare  District Office

title: Long Term-Loan to SC Co-op Spinning Mills under Special Component Plan

details.Name Of the Scheme: Long Term-Loan to SC Co-op Spinning Mills under Special Component Plan
details.Scheme Objective: To promote the spinning mills of scheduled caste members
details.Eligibility Criteria: There are 1 to 24 terms and conditions. Main conditions are-          The concern spinning mill has to collect Rs. 80.00 lacks or minimum 5 per cent cost of project to be collected as member shares.          The Director of textile and Handloom Maharashtra State, Nagpur sanctions 9 times amount of the member share of the spinning mill as Government share capital and Department of Social Welfare sanction 1:1 (50 per cent of the project cost) financial assistance as long term basis loan to such spinning mills          The project submitted by the pinning mill should be enumerated by the financial institutions/ banks that provide loan to the spinning mill. In addition to this the project report can be checked / enumerated by following institutions and submit to government. The enumeration fee is fixed for Rs. 2.50 lakhs. The project enumeration cost should be bared by the spinning mill.          Maharashtra Industrial & Technical consultancy Organization Lmt. (MITCON), Pune.          Agriculture financial Corporation, Mumbai          Dattajirao Technical Institute, Ichalkarangi.
details.Benefits Provided: 50 per cent of Project cost is provided as a loan by social welfare department.
details.Application Process: Application has to be submitted to Textile department, Govt. of Maharashtra. After approval and sanction of share capital. Then application should be submitted to Assistant Commissioner, Social Welfare District Office. Social welfare department sanction 50 % loan to these spinning mills.
details.Contact Office: Assistant Commissioner, Social Welfare  District Office

title: 1. 25% Margin Money Loan Scheme. 2. Rs. 25,000/- Direct Loan Scheme.

details.Name of the Scheme: 25% Margin Money Loan Scheme.    Rs. 25,000/- Direct Loan Scheme.
details.Scheme Objective: Provide loan on nominal rate of interest to the economically weak people who belongs to Vimukta Jatis (Denotified Tribes), Nomadic Tribes and Special Backward Class for their financial, educational and social upliftment.
details.Beneficiary Category: Vimukta Jatis (Denotified Tribes) / Nomadic Tribes / Special Backward Class.
details.Eligibility Criteria: Applicant should be a resident of Maharashtra State.     Applicant must be from Vimukta Jatis, Nomadic Tribes and Special Backward Class.     Age of applicant should be between 18 to 45 years.     Unpaid debt of Government or any other financial corporation / foundation should not remain with an applicant.     For the State Corporation scheme applicant belonging from Urban and Rural sector should have their family income of Rs. 1,00,000/- and for Central Corporation schemes, applicant from Urban sector must Rs. 1,20,000/- and that of Rural sector must be Rs. 98,000/-.     Under this Corporation’s scheme, applicant will not get any sort of loan / subsidy from governmental activities for more than one time.     Terms mentioned by the Corporation are mandatory for the beneficiaries, time to time.     Only one member of the each family will get the lone for once.
details.Benefits Provided: 25% Margin Money Loan Scheme.   Project Limit (Rs.)   Rs. 5,00,000/-   Bank Share (%)  75 %   Corporation’s Share (%) 25 %   Rate of Interest (%)    4 %   Return Period    5 Yrs. Rs. 25,000/- Direct Loan Scheme.   Project Limit (Rs.)     Rs. 25,000/-   Corporation’s Share (%)   100 %   Rate of Interest (%)   2 %   Return Period   4 Yrs.
details.Application Process: Caste Certificate and Income Certificate given by eligible authority.     Detailed information related to the scheme, under that availability of raw material, sale of final product. In short, need to submit project report.     Attested copy of the Certificate, if applicant has taken any technical training.     Rent receipt / Agreement letter copy / Ownership proof of the place where applicant wants to commerce their business.  Proof of earlier business experience, if any.    Attested copy of Ration Card.     While applying for auto rickshaw, copy of Driving License and RTO License are necessary to submit.     Proof of Number plate and auto rickshaw booking copy from the dealer should be submitted for applying for finance of auto rickshaw.     Proof/s of eligibility of the 2 guarantor- E.g. 7/12 Utara, etc.     It is compulsory for the beneficiary to use the loan amount only for the loan amount only for the proposed business/occupation on the basis of submitted project report.     It is mandatory to fill all the columns of the application form without any overwriting and have to present 2 copies by the applicant. Attach passport size photographs on both application forms.  Note – While submitting the loan application original documents to be needed for verification.
details.Contact Office: Vasantrao Naik Vimukta Jatis And Nomadic Tribes Development Corporation (Limited) Head Office : 1st Floor, Juhu Supreme Shopping Centre, Gulmohar Cross Road No.9, J.V.P.D. Scheme (North), Vile Parle (West), Mumbai – 400 049. Telephone: 022 – 2620 2586 / 2620 2588. E-mail: vnvjntdc@gmail.com

title: Mahila Kisan Yojana

details.Name of the Scheme: Mahila Kisan Yojana
details.Funding by: Central  Government Schemes      National Scheduled  Castes Finance and Development Corporation, New Delhi (NSFDC)
details.Scheme Objective: The main object of the  Corporation is to implement various schemes to uplift lifestyle of  Charmakars (Dhor, Chambhar, Holar,Mochi etc.) who are economically  weak and below poverty line and with an intention to develop them  educationally, economically and socially so as to give them  respectable place in Society. Also production of various types of  Footwear & Leather Articles & supply to Government  Departments & sale in Open Market.
details.Eligibility Criteria: (1) Applicantmust be of Charmakar Community only.      (2) Age Limit should be in between 18 to 50 years      (3) For 50% Subsidy Scheme and Margin Money, Annual Income of the applicants must be below poverty line and for NSFDC Scheme, income for Rural area should be below 98,000/- and for Urban Rs.1,20,000/-.      (4) Applicants must be permanent resident of Maharashtra State.      (5) He must produce the Income and Caste Certificate of Authorised Govt.Officer.      Applicant must have a knowledge of the business for which he has applied for loan.
details.Benefits Provided: Under this scheme loan of Rs. 50,000/- in  which Rs.10,000/- is subsidy and remaining Rs.40,000/- is loan at  the rate of 5% p.a. for female beneficiaries of Charmakar  Community where her name is in 7/12 extract of land or  husband-wife’s joint name on 7/12 extract of land or where name  of husband is on 7/12 extract and he makes an affidavit to  sanction loan for the agricultural projects related to  agricultural.
details.Application Process: Application  form is available at District Office of LIDCOM.      Applicant must fill form and  submit to District Office of LIDCOM
details.Contact Office: List Enclosed.

title: Term Loan Scheme

details.Name of the Scheme: Term Loan Scheme
details.Funding by: Central  Government Schemes  National Scheduled  Castes Finance and Development Corporation, New Delhi (NSFDC)
details.Scheme Objective: The main object of the  Corporation is to implement various schemes to uplift lifestyle of  Charmakars (Dhor, Chambhar, Holar,Mochi etc.) who are economically  weak and below poverty line and with an intention to develop them  educationally, economically and socially so as to give them  respectable place in Society. Also production of various types of  Footwear & Leather Articles & supply to Government  Departments & sale in Open Market.
details.Eligibility Criteria: (1) Applicant  must be of Charmakar Community only.      (2) Age  Limit should be in between 18 to 50 years      (3) For  50% Subsidy Scheme and Margin Money, Annual Income of the  applicants must be below poverty line and for NSFDC Scheme,  income for Rural area should be below 98,000/- and for Urban  Rs.1,20,000/-.      (4) Applicants  must be permanent resident of Maharashtra State.      (5) He  must produce the Income and Caste Certificate of Authorised  Govt.Officer.      (6) Applicant  must have a knowledge of the business for which he has applied  for loan.
details.Benefits Provided: Corporation  is  implementing the Term Loan Scheme of NSFDC , New Delhi from the  year 2002-03. For implementing the said Schemes, Govt.of  Maharashtra has given Govt.Guarantee  for Rs.15 Crores in the year  2001-02 and now Government has given Guarantee of Rs.31.15 Crores  in the year 2014-15.      Under the Term  Loan Scheme,Corporation are disbursing the loan for the purpose of  various business to the beneficiaries of Charmakar Community.NSFDC  is providing Term Loan from Rs.1,00,000/- to Rs.2,50,000/- to  various schemes. Also there are different limits for Vehicle  Loans. Term Loan of 75% of the Project Coast is Sanctioned by  NSFDC, Corporation is giving 20% Seed Loan & Rs.10,000/- as  subsidy and remaining 5% is contribution of the beneficiary. NSFDC  is charging interest @7% p.a. on its loan & Corporation is  charging 4% p.a. For term loans above Rs.5,00,000/- NSFDC is  charging interest @8% p.a. and Corporation is charging interest @  4% p.a. Term Loan installment is payable every month for a period  up to 60 months.
details.Application Process: Application  form is available at District Office of LIDCOM.      Applicant must fill form and  submit to District Office of LIDCOM
details.Contact Office: List Enclosed.

title: Margin Money Loan Scheme

details.Name of the Scheme: Margin Money Loan  Scheme
details.Scheme Objective: The main object of the  Corporation is to implement various schemes to uplift lifestyle of  Charmakars (Dhor, Chambhar, Holar,Mochi etc.) who are economically  weak and below poverty line and with an intention to develop them  educationally, economically and socially so as to give them  respectable place in Society. Also production of various types of  Footwear & Leather Articles & supply to Government  Departments & sale in Open Market.
details.Eligibility Criteria: Applicant  must be of Charmakar Community only.      Age  Limit should be in between 18 to 50 years       For  50% Subsidy Scheme and Margin Money, Annual Income of the  applicants must be below poverty line and for NSFDC Scheme,  income for Rural area should be below 98,000/- and for Urban  Rs.1,20,000/-.      Applicants  must be permanent resident of Maharashtra State.      He  must produce the Income and Caste Certificate of Authorised  Govt.Officer.      Applicant  must have a knowledge of the business for which he has applied  for loan.
details.Benefits Provided: The income  limit of the beneficiary is same as per 50% subsidy scheme.  Loan  limit is from Rs.50,001 to Rs.5,00,000/-.      There are two  parts of this scheme which is based on loan amount Loan  between  Rs.50,001/- to Rs.1,00,000/- 25% Loan will be given by Corporation  @ Rs.4% interest p.a. Maximum Rs.10,000/- will be paid as subsidy  by Corporation. 75% loan will be given by Bank @ 9.50% to 12.50%  interest p.a.Loan between Rs.1,00,000/- to Rs.2,00,000/- 20% of  Project cost loan as Seed Capital will be paid by Corporation @ 4%  interest p.a.  Maximum Rs.10,000/- will be paid as subsidy by  Corporation.  5% amount of project cost will have to be  contributed by beneficiary as his share.  Balance 75% of project  cost will be paid by Bank. The said amount of loan is to be  refunded within 36 to 60 monthly installments
details.Application Process: Application  form is available at District Office of LIDCOM.      Applicant must fill form and  submit to District Office of LIDCOM
details.Contact Office: List Enclosed.

details.Main Objective: With the main objective of raising the standard of living of member of  the Matang Community & its 12 sub caste living below poverty line in Maharashtra State securing to them a place of respect in the main stream of society & assisting them in their educational ,economic & social redevelopment as well as to provide financial assistance that will necessary & useful for their upliftment.

The applicant should be a member of one of the 12 Sub-caste of the Matang Community. Chart / list of rates of authorized Dealer / Company in respect of prices / booking for the purpose is to be carried on.          Technical certificate of experience pertaining to the business.          Project report of the goods / Quotations in respect of the goods and material to be purchased.          Affidavit (on a stamp paper).

title: 1) Term Loan 2)Education Loan 3) Micro Credit Scheme 4) Scheme for NGOs 5) Direct Loan Scheme

details.Name of the Scheme: Term Loan          Education Loan          Micro Credit Scheme          Scheme for NGOs          Direct Loan Scheme
details.Funding by: State Govt Scheme- Direct Loan Scheme        National Handicapped finance Corporation Delhi -  Term Loan & Other Scheme
details.Scheme Objective: To undertake, carry on, assist to carry on and promote economic development activities including self employment and other ventures for benefit and economic rehabilitation of handicapped persons regardless of their religion, sex, caste and age, in collaboration with State Government Ministries/Departments, extend financial assistance/loans/concessional finance to handicapped persons for implementing economically and financially viable schemes /projects, to grant loans to the handicapped for pursuing education at graduation and higher levels, to assist in up gradation/ improvement of technical and entrepreneurial skills, to set up training, quality control, process development and other infrastructural development activities aimed to achieve economic rehabilitation/upliftment of handicapped persons, to assist other organizations engaged in rehabilitation of the handicapped by providing financial assistance, to assist businesses run by handicapped persons in procuring raw materials and marketing finished goods and to work as an Apex Institution for the State  of Maharashtra for channelizing the funds received from State Finance Corporation or the Central Government
details.Eligibility Criteria: Any Disabled person who fulfills the following criteria is eligible to avail financial assistance        a) Any Indian Citizen with 40% or more disability.        b) Age above 18 years.        c) Relevant educational / technical / vocational qualification/ experience and background.
details.Benefits Provided: This Corporation has given Business Loan to Persons with Disabilities (PWDs) in low interest rate.
details.Application Process: Manually Loan form & Disbursement procedure is in process at District level through OBC corporation and online loan procedure is in process after completion then online loan procedure apply.
details.Category of Scheme: Education loan            Self Employment Scheme            Economic Upliftment
Maharashtra State Handicapped Finance & Development Corporation, Bandra (E) Mumbai-51        Telephone No - 022-26591620/22                                 Tel Fax 022-2659162

title: Rs.25,000/- Direct Loan Scheme (State Government through Share Capital of the Corporation.)

details.Name of the Scheme: Rs.25,000/- Direct Loan Scheme
details.Funding by: State Government through Share Capital of the Corporation.
details.Scheme Objective: To provide loan for miscellaneous activities at minimum period and documents.
details.Eligibility Criteria: Applicant should be OBC Category.He should be domicile of Maharashtra State.Age between 18 to 50 yrs.Annual Income of the family Rs.1.00 lakh p.a. for rural and urban areas.
details.Benefits Provided: Provide loan directly to beneficiaries at bear minimum interest rate.
details.Application Process: Loan application should be submitted to concern District Office in prescribed loan application along with required documents.
details.Contact Office: Concern District Office of the Corporation.

title: Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme

details.Name of the Scheme: Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme
details.Scheme Objective: Pension Scheme
details.Eligibility Criteria: A widow in age group of 40 to 65 years whose family falls under Below Poverty Line is eligible under this Scheme. She is initialed to receive Rs 200/- per month under this scheme. She also receives Rs 400/- per month under state sponsored Sanjay Gandhi Niradhar Anudan Yojana.
details.Benefits Provided: Under this scheme, Rs. 600 per month is given to each beneficiary.
details.Application Process: Under this scheme application is submitted to Collector Office/Tahsildar/Talathi
details.Contact Office: Collector Office/Tahsildar/Talathi

title: Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme

details.Name of the Scheme: Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme
details.Scheme Objective: Pension Scheme
details.Eligibility Criteria: A Disable person in the age group of 18 to 65 years and having 80 percent disability is eligible under this Scheme. He / She is entitled to receive Rs. 200/- per month under this Scheme. He / She also receives Rs 400/- per month under State sponsored Sanjay Gandhi Niradhar Anudan Yojana
details.Benefits Provided: Under this scheme, Rs. 600 per month is given to each beneficiary.
details.Application Process: Under this scheme application is submitted to Collector Office/Tahsildar/Talathi
details.Contact Office: Collector Office/Tahsildar/Talathi

title: Sanjay Gandhi Niradhar Anudan Yojana

details.Name of the Scheme: Sanjay Gandhi Niradhar Anudan Yojana
details.Scheme Objective: Financial Assistance / Pension Scheme
details.Eligibility Criteria: This scheme is applicable to destitute persons of age below 65 years, orphan children, all types of handicapped, person suffering from critical illness like T. B. cancer, AIDS and leprosy, destitute windows including those of farmers who committed suicide, destitute divorced women and women in process of divorce, women freed from prostitution and outraged women.
details.Benefits Provided: Under this scheme, Rs. 600 per month is given to a single beneficiary and Rs. 900 per month if there are two or more beneficiaries in the family.  Whose family annual income is up to Rs. 21,000/-
details.Application Process: Under this scheme application is submitted to Collector Office/Tahsildar/Talathi
details.Contact Office: Collector Office / Tahsildar / Talathi

title: Shravan Bal sea Rajya Nivruttivetan Yojana

details.Name of the Scheme: Shravan bal seva  rajya Nivruttivetan Yojana
details.Scheme Objective: Pension Scheme
details.Eligibility Criteria: Category - (A) Under this Scheme every destitute person of age 65 years & above &whose annual family income is below Rs. 21000/- & whose name is not included in the BPL List get Rs.600/- per month from the state Govt.  Category - (B)Also under this scheme, every destitute person of age 65 years and above and belonging to BPL  family is eligible to get pension of Rs. 400/- per month from the state Govt. and the same beneficiary also receives pension of Rs.200/- per month from the Central Govt., under Indira Gandhi National Old Age pension Scheme.
details.Benefits Provided: Under this scheme, Rs. 600 per month is given to each beneficiary.
details.Application Process: Under this scheme application is submitted to Collector Office/Tahsildar/Talathi
details.Contact Office: Collector Office/Tahsildar/Talathi

title: National Family Benefit Scheme

details.Name of the Scheme: National Family Benefit Scheme
details.Scheme Objective: Financial Assistance
details.Eligibility Criteria: Under this Scheme in case of death of a primary bread winner in the BPL Family in the age group of 18 to 59 years, the affected family is provided with one time Lump sum Financial assistance of Rs. 20000/- from the central government.
details.Benefits Provided: One time Lump sum Financial assistance of Rs. 20000/-
details.Application Process: Under this scheme application is submitted to Collector Office/Tahsildar/Talathi
details.Contact Office: Collector Office/Tahsildar/Talathi

title: Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme

details.Name of the Scheme: Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme
details.Scheme Objective: Pension Scheme
details.Eligibility Criteria: Old aged person of 65 years & above belonging to BPL Family are eligible under this Scheme. Beneficiaries under this scheme receive Rs.200/- from Govt. of India & Rs.400/- from Govt. of Maharashtra under Shravanbal Seva Rajya Nivrutti vetan Yojana. In all the beneficiary receives Rs. 600/- per month.
details.Benefits Provided: Under this scheme, Rs. 600 per month is given to each beneficiary.
details.Application Process: Under this scheme application is submitted to Collector Office/Tahsildar/Talathi
details.Contact Office: Collector Office/Tahsildar/Talathi

title: Aam Aadmi Bima Yojana

details.Name of the Scheme: Aam Aadmi Bima Yojana
details.Scheme Objective: Insurance & scholarship.
details.Eligibility Criteria: This scheme is meant for land less labourers in rural areas in the age Group of 18-59 years. The premium charged under the scheme will be Rs. 200/- per annum per member out of which 50% is subsidized by the State Govt. and Central Govt.
details.Benefits Provided: In case of natural death of a member, prior to terminal date, the sum assured Rs. 30,000/- under assurance, then in force, shall become payable to the nominee.        The following benefits are provided to the member in case of accident.        On death due to accident Rs. 75, 000/-            Permanent total disability, due to accident Rs. 75, 000/-        Loss of 2 eyes and 2 limbs in an accident Rs. 75, 000/-Loss of 1 eyes and 1 limbs in an accident Rs. 37, 500/-        Under this scheme, Scholarship of Rs. 100/- per month each is given to the children studying in 9th to 12th standards. The maximum 2 children are given scholarship.
details.Application Process: Under this scheme application is submitted to Collector Office/Tahsildar/Talathi
details.Contact Office: Collector Office/Tahsildar/Talathi

title: Special Education and Vocational Training through Government institutions

details.Name of the Scheme: Special Education and Vocational Training through Government institutions
details.Scheme objective: Special education is provided to disabled children between age group of 6 to 18 years in the government special schools. Vocational training is also provided to special children’s above the age of 18 years.
details.Eligibility criteria: 1.Application in given format submitted to concern        Govt. Institution        2.Applicant should have minimum 40% disability.        3.Applicant should be Domicile in Maharashtra.
details.Benefits Provided: Child with a disability has access to free education in an appropriate environment till he / she attains the age of eighteen years & above 18 years vocational training given to special children. The free facilities of food, shelter, clothing and education are provided in these institutions
details.Application process: Application in prescribed form with necessary documents submitted to Concern Govt. Institute
details.Contact Office: Government Institution and District social welfare office Zillah Parishad/Assistant Commissioner Social welfare office Mumbai urban / Mumbai suburban

title: Non-Governmental Aided organization (Special Schools and Vocational Training Centre) for Disable.

details.Name of the Scheme: Non-Governmental Aided organization (Special Schools and Vocational Training Centre) for Disable.
details.Scheme objective: Special education is provided to disabled children below the age of 18 years in the special school which are run by Non-Governmental Aided organization. Vocational training is also given to special children above 18 yrs
details.Beneficiaries Category: Visually Impaired, Hearing Impaired ,Orthopedically Handicapped, Mentally Retarded
details.Eligibility criteria: 1.Application in given format submitted to concern special        School / Vocational Training centre.        2. Applicant should have minimum 40% disability.        3.Applicant should be Domicile in Maharashtra
details.Benefits Provided: Child with a disability has access to free education in an appropriate environment till he / she attains the age of eighteen years. Above 18 years vocational training is given to disabled children. Also free facilities of food, shelter and education are provided in residential institutions.
details.Application process: Application in given format attached with necessary documents submitted to Concern voluntary organization
details.Contact Office: voluntary organization and District social welfare office Zillah Parishad/Assistant Commissioner Social welfare office Mumbai urban / Mumbai suburban

title: The Scheme of State Award for Disabled

details.Name of the Scheme: The Scheme of State Award for Disabled
details.Scheme objective: Every year the State Government has felicitated awards to the Best Disabled Employees / Employers / Placement Agency who have done outstanding work in various fields.
details.Beneficiaries Category: visually handicapped, Low vision, hearing impaired, and orthopedically handicapped and Mentally Retarded
details.Eligibility criteria: 1.Apply in prescribed form submitted to concern District Social Welfare Office, Zillah Parishad $ Assistant Commissioner Social Welfare Department ,Mumbai Urban & Mumbai Suburban        2..Applicant should have minimum 40% disability.        3.Applicant should be Domicile in Maharashtra.
details.Application process: Application in prescribed form attached with necessary documents/bio data/outstanding work in the disability sector.
details.Contact Office: District Social Welfare Office, Zillah Parishad $ Assistant Commissioner Social Welfare Office ,Mumbai Urban & Mumbai Suburban
